text: Edward E. Coughlin (August 5, 1861 - December 25, 1952) was a Major League Baseball outfielder and pitcher. Coughlin played in one game for the Buffalo Bisons on May 15, . Coughlin was born in Hartford, Connecticut to Irish parents.Census entry for Edward E. Coughlin. Ancestry.com. 1910 United States Federal Census. Year: 1910; Census Place: Hartford Ward 4, Hartford, Connecticut; Roll: T624_132; Page: 2A; Enumeration District: 0169; Image: 1190; FHL Number: 13741451. On May 15, 1884, he made his first and only appearance in a major league game for the Buffalo Bisons of the National League. Buffalo played the Philadelphia Quakers.August 4, 1873 at Retrosheet He was used as both an outfielder and a pitcher in that game. As a pitcher, he faced five batters, allowed four runs, three of them earned, and threw two wild pitches. He left the mound without recording an out. In the outfield, he recorded two putouts, and made one error. At the plate, Coughlin batted four times, struk out twice, and collected a hit. He also drove in a run.Ed Coughlin at Baseball-Reference.com In addition to his one major league game, Coughlin played in the minor leagues in 1884 and . He played for both Youngstown of the Iron & Oil Association and Hartford in the Connecticut State League in 1884. In 1886, he played in the New England League with the Brockton ball club.Ed Coughlin at Baseball-Reference.com/Minors He died in Hartford in 1952 at the age of 91. He is buried at Mount St. Benedict Cemetery in Bloomfield, Connecticut.Ed Coughlin at Retrosheet.org ==References== ==External links== *Retrosheet * Ed Coughlin Memorial at Find a Grave Category:1861 births Category:1952 deaths Category:Buffalo Bisons (NL) players Category:Major League Baseball pitchers Category:Baseball players from Connecticut Category:Youngstown (minor league baseball) players Category:Hartford (minor league baseball) players Category:Brockton (minor league baseball) players Category:Sportspeople from Hartford, Connecticut Category:19th-century baseball players
title: Ed Coughlin
